author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Election Officials on Sunday seized 600 hot boxes which were suspected to be brought for distribution to voters in Puducherry in the run up to the forthcoming Assembly elections.

An election surveillance squad headed by Deputy Tahsildar Balakrishnan intercepted a mini vehicle coming from Chennai at Kanapathichettikulam on Sunday.

When the driver Loganathan was quizzed, his answers were not convincing.

Following intimation from Election Officials, the Kalapet police rushed to the spot and interrogated the driver.

Apparently during interrogation, the driver said that he was instructed by a shop owner in Chennai over phone to wait for further instructions at Kanapathichettikulam.

The driver was not able to furnish the bill or the consignee’s address, except a mobile phone number.

District Election Officer and Collector S. Sundaravadivelu inspected the consignment seized and held discussions with the officials. Further inquiry is on.
title: 600 hot boxes seized
